Legal_Issue: Did the visa officer err in rejecting the applications without an interview and by overemphasizing lack of business experience?
Application_Facts: Applicants intended to be self-employed in cultural fields but were rejected due to lack of formal business experience and insufficient financial assets.
Decision_Outcome: Visa officer erred; applications remanded for reconsideration.
Court_Ruling: Applications allowed; matters sent back for reconsideration by a different visa officer.
Claimant_Status: Self-employed applicant seeking immigration to Canada
Defendant_Behavior: Visa officer rejected applications without conducting required interviews and placed undue emphasis on lack of business experience.
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to conduct interview, misapplication of eligibility criteria, overemphasis on business experience.
Legal_Standard: Requirement to conduct interview under s. 11.1(b); proper assessment of intent and ability to contribute to Canadian economy or cultural life.
Assessment_Factor: Intent and ability to establish a business contributing to Canada's economy or cultural life.
Procedural_Issue: Failure to conduct mandatory interview for self-employed applicants.
Evidence_Used: Applicants' stated intent, proposed cultural contributions, financial documentation, lack of formal business background.
Application_Basis: Self-employment in cultural field with economic or cultural contribution to Canada.
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of formal business experience, insufficient financial assets.
Relief_Sought: Allowance of immigration applications and redetermination by a different officer.
Governing_Rule: A visa officer must conduct an interview for self-employed applicants under s. 11.1(b).
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient consideration of applicants’ potential contributions despite lack of business history.
Decisional_Body: Visa officer initially; reviewed by court, then remanded.
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of immigration opportunity due to procedural error.
Cause_Description: Applications denied based on perceived lack of business experience and financial resources.
Evidence_Handling: Visa officer did not fairly assess evidence of applicants’ potential cultural contributions.
Evidence_Issues: Overemphasis on one factor (business experience) while neglecting others (cultural contribution potential).
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and biased assessment favoring formal business experience over statutory criteria.
Decision_Rationale: Interview required by regulation was not conducted; undue weight given to non-determinative factor.
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider all relevant factors in assessing self-employment eligibility.
Legal_Standard_Applied: Statutory requirement for interview and holistic assessment of self-employment potential.
